general-information.question: In Section II of the Declaration of Principles, the Philippines renounces ________ as an instrument of national policy:
According to Article II, Section 6 of the Constitution, separation of the church and state shall be inviolable.
In accordance with Art. III, Sec. 15 of the Constitution, the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus shall not be suspended ONLY in the cases of:
Right to freely publish and say whatever pleases to do based on Art. III, Sec. 4 of the Constitution.
It is an inherent power of the State to take private property for public use given just compensation.
Another inherent power of the State to enact and enforce laws in relation to persons and properties.
An inherent power of the State to impose charge or burden such as charged upon persons and properties.
Which of the following is considered nepotism based on Art. VII, Section 13 of the Constitution?
options: President appointing his college professor as Secretary to Education.
President has three children who are local officials.
President appointed his fellow in a fraternity as Chief of PNP.
President appointed his third-degree cousin as the Ombudsman.
President appointed his drinking buddies as cabinet secretaries.

general-information.question: How many times may a President be elected consecutively?

No person who has succeeded as President and has served as such for years shall be qualified for election to the same office any more than _____ years shall be qualified for election to the same office any time.
A presidential veto can be overridden with a _____ vote of both Senate and House of Representatives.
When former Chief Justice Corona was impeached a vote of ______ from the Senate resulted in his conviction.
According to Art. VII, Sec. 1 of the Constitution, all the executive power shall be vested in the _______
options: Chief Justice and members of the Courts

general-information.question: How long immediately before the next presidential elections and up to the end of his term is a President not allowed to make appointments?
Art. VII, Sec 18 of the Constitution gives what position in the Armed Forces of the Philippines to the President?
options: Four Star General of the Armed Forces

general-information.question: Which of the following may disqualify a person to run as Vice-President?
options: Seventy years old on the day of the election.
Has Filipino parents but born in the United States.
Lived in abroad 9 years preceding the election.

general-information.question: It is the process of amending and revising the Constitution.
Which of the following is NOT TRUE about paying tax in the Philippines?
options: It goes to state's debts alone

general-information.question: Any member of the Supreme Court must:
options: Not be a member of Philippine Bar.
Have been a judge of a lower court for 15 years or more.
Have been a judge of Court of Appeals for 10 years.

general-information.question: It is the power of a President to postpone the execution of death penalty.
It is the power of a President to reduce the sentence imposed to a lesser punishment such as from death to life imprisonment.
Which body has the power to hear and decide on all Impeachment cases?
Elective or appointive public officials or employees are prohibited to accept any kind of present, compensation or any title of any kind from any foreign government without the consent of _______
According to the 1987 Constitution, the State is mandated to invest the highest budget to ______
How many votes are needed for the Congress or a Constitutional Assembly to propose an amendment or revision of the present 1987 Constitution?
It is an imposed contribution from persons or properties levied by the law-making body of the state.
Article III, section 11 of the Constitution provides every person the free access to:
The maximum number of consecutive terms that a member of the Senate may serve.
The president must be a resident of the Philippines for at least how many years immediately preceding an election?
The minimum age requirement for a person seeking the vice-presidential position.
Citizenship acquired by legal process.
The first word written in the 1987 Philippine Constitution.
It is the right and obligation of qualified citizens during elections to vote.
It is a vote of people expressing their choice for or against a proposed law.
It is a vote to ratify or reject a certain law passed by the national or local legislative body.
It is a process by which the Filipino people can directly propose a law.
A method by which voters can remove an elected official from office through a direct vote before the end of his/her term.
Which of the following is NOT a qualification of a registered voter?
options: Have resided in the Philippines for one year.
Have resided in the place where he will vote for at least 6 months.
Must be able to read and write.

general-information.question: A voter's name shall be deleted from the official voter's registration list for the failure to vote in how many elections?
If a President wishes to veto a bill, he/she must communicate it within a certain span of time, otherwise, the bill will become a law. How long is this span of time?

One of the functions of the government is to enter into treaties and agreements with the governments of other states. However, such agreements will only be valid and effective when the concurrence of a specific government entity has been given. Which of the following is this entity?
What is regarded by the State as the primary social-economic force?
The following are blessings of democracy provided by Art. II, Sec. 5 of the Constitution EXCEPT:
Who has the sole power to declare the existence of war as provided by Art. VI, Sec. 23 of the Constitution?
If a plaintiff is a minor who is a victim of a rape case, the state may invoke such right to protect the victim's rights in case of her incapability to prosecute the case. What is this called?
Who is the third highest government official in the Philippines?
When is the deadline for filing income tax returns every taxable year?
Which of the following does the Constitution provide a special election for registered Overseas Filipino Workers?
Who can grant emergency powers to the President, especially in times of war?
Which among these bills does not come from the House of Representatives?
A presidential veto can be overridden with a _____ vote of both Senate and House of Representatives.
A bill becomes a law in the following processes EXCEPT for one, what is it?
options: If it's approved by the President.
If it's not acted upon by the President within 30 days after the date of receipt.
If the President vetoes the bill.
If the President returns the bill and communicates his objections to the House where it originated and the same re-passed over his veto by a vote of two-thirds of both Houses.
If it's signed by the President.

general-information.question: Tax paid on one's right to transmit property at death and measured by the value of such property?
What tax is paid by citizens who derived income by compensation?
Article VII, Sec. 2 of the 1987 Constitution provides that a presidential candidate has a minimum residency requirement of how many years?
According to Article VII, Sec. 3 of the 1987 Constitution, what is the minimum age requirement of a presidential candidate?

Art VI, Sec. 25 of the Constitution provides that a special Appropriation Bill shall specify the purpose for which it is intended and shall be supported by funds actually available and shall be certified by which body?
All the citizens may be called upon by the Government to protect the State under conditions provided by the law.
It is known as the fundamental law of the land.
The following are lands of the public domain except:
What may be classified as alienable lands of the public domain?
According to Article II, Section I of the Constitution, the Philippines is a ______ and ______ State.
It is the introductory or prologue of the 1987 Philippine Constitution.
The following are reasons for a voter to be disqualified EXCEPT:
options: Any person who has been sentenced by final judgment to suffer imprisonment for not less than one year.
Any person who has been sentenced by final judgment of having committed rebellion, sedition, firearms laws.
Insane persons declared by competent authority.
Any person who is 18 years old at the time of voter's registration.
Any person who is not able to vote for two consecutive elections.

general-information.question: The legislative power shall be vested in which bodies according to Art. VI, Sec. 1 of the Constitution.
It is the authority under the Constitution to make, amend and repeal laws.
It is the minimum requirement for a Senatorial candidate according to Article VI, Section 3 of the Constitution.
Party-list representatives shall constitute how many per centum of the total number of representatives including those under the party-list?

No bill passed by either of the HOR and Senate shall become law unless it has passed ______ readings on separate days, and printed copies thereof in its final form have been distributed to its members three days before its passage.
The President shall notify ______ of every contract entered into in accordance with national economy provision, within thirty days from its execution.
It is an agency which shall function as the independent planning agency of the government.
The House of Representatives shall consist of not more than _______ members in accordance with Art. VI, Sec. 5 of the Constitution.
It constitutes twenty per centum of the total number of representatives.
It is the minimum age requirement of a House Representative in accordance with the Art. VI, Sec., 6 of the Constitution.
How many times a House Representative may be elected consecutively as provided for by Art. VI, Sec. 7 of the Constitution?
The tenure of office for a House Representative each term.
How many Senators do we elect every Senatorial election?
According to Art. VI, Section 4 of the Constitution, a Senator has a total tenure of how many years?
How many times may a Senator be elected consecutively according to Art. VI, Section 4 of the Constitution?
According to Art. IX, Sec. 1, the following are Constitutional Bodies EXCEPT:
The Philippine Government, having been following the principle of separation of powers is subdivided into three branches, what are those?
options: Office of the President, Senate, Congress

general-information.question: A body created under the 1987 Constitution to investigate acts or omission of any public officer which appear to be illegal, unjust, improper or inefficient.
The Article in the Constitution which defines all the territorial boundaries of the Philippines
The right of a person under investigation for allegedly committing a criminal act involves:
options: Right to a fair trial, right to be presumed innocent, and right to counsel
Compelling a person to testify against oneself
Right to be detained even without formal charge
Right to plead guilty for immediate release
Right to be maltreated for information sake

general-information.question: It provides citizenship through blood relationship.
It provides citizenship by the place where a person was born.
It means retroactive effect of a law, making an act punishable even if it was committed before the act punishing it was passed.
The following constitutes due process of law EXCEPT:
options: The accused shall be tried before a competent court.
The accused must be given a fair and impartial trial.
The accused must be denied of public legal assistance.
The accused must be allowed to use all legal means to defend himself.
The judgment awarded against the accused must be within the authority of the law.

general-information.question: The Commission on Human Rights has all the following powers and functions, EXCEPT
options: Investigate all forms of human rights violation
Exercise visitorial powers over jails and prison
Recommend measures to promote human rights
Adopt and implement its operational guidelines and rules on procedures

general-information.question: It is considered the National Language in the Philippines.
It is considered the primordial duty of the Government.
options: To ensure protection of life, liberty and property.
To collect taxes and serve people.

general-information.question: It is considered a basic and autonomous social institution.
A constitutional process that hears before it condemns, which proceeds upon inquiry and renders judgment only after trial.
Who among the following cannot be removed from office by impeachment?
It is also known as the 'pork barrel'.
Who has the authority to recommend nominees for the members of the Supreme Court and judges of the lower courts to the President?
options: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court

general-information.question: It is considered as an accessory penalty to an impeachment case.
options: Perpetual disqualification from holding public office

general-information.question: Under which branch of the government do the Senators, Senate President, House Speaker, and House Representatives belong?
Who was the President of the 1987 Constitutional Commission?
It is considered as the lower chamber of the Congress.
